Hi Tony

Maybe I was a little enthusiastic, not me normally, it must have been 
good. I have never read your book, is that true do they take their 
ideas from your books, thats a pretty cool compliment then, they say 
imitaition is the best compliment.  I still think the detail is good 
I am no expert but I have seen other complanies 25mm and there Bushi 
ranges are to put it kind poor/.  (^_^) (^O^) I do think they are too 
expensive though.  I might have to buy your book sometime to check 
that out.  Maybe you should get them to put a link to your book, they 
have Turnbulls, by the bucket load (what a surprise!). 

Anyways cheers for replying 

Mark   


 
 ------------------------------------------------------------------
A.J Bryant wrote

Mwa ha ha!!

I love it. Take a look at the first graphic on
 http://www.eastofindia.com/spring2001_1.htm and then plate J-K in my 
first
 book ("The Samurai"). I wonder where they get their inspiration... 
<G>
 
 Right down to the poses...
 
 I gotta tell you, though. That level of detail is what I'd expect in 
a 24mm.
 Not a 54.
 
> Tony
